thread.title: Russian billionaire's row over £340m superyacht seized in Gibraltar 'resolved'
thread.title_full: Russian billionaire's row over £340m superyacht seized in Gibraltar 'resolved'

author: Mark Molloy
title: Russian billionaire's row over £340m superyacht seized in Gibraltar 'resolved'
text:
Russian billionaire's row over £340m superyacht seized in Gibraltar 'resolved' Andrey Melnichenko’s Sailing Yacht A was seized in Gibraltar Credit: AP /David Parody Mark Molloy  39am 
A Russian billionaire’s superyacht has been released by authorities in Gibraltar after it was seized over a claim about an unsettled bill, reports say. 
Andrey Melnichenko’s owns the world’s largest sailing yacht, reportedly worth €400m (£336), which was impounded by the Gibraltar Port Authority. 
The Gibraltar Chronicle newspaper reported that German shipbuilder Nobiskrug claimed the Russian industrialist owed €15.3m (£13.3m) in overdue fees for the 143m (469ft) luxury superyacht, known as Sailing Yacht A. Sailing Yact A is reportedly worth £340m Credit: AP 
A spokesperson for Sailing Yacht A said the vessel has now been released by authorities after the two parties reportedly reached a resolution about the claim. 
“This unfortunate incident involving Sailing Yacht A has now been resolved,” a spokesperson for the vessel’s owner said. 
“The yacht will be handed over to the owner’s project team and will leave Gibraltar shortly.” Sailing Yacht A off the coast Gibraltar Credit: EPA One of the largest sailing yachts ever built, the 'A' pulling up alongside 1E at the North Mole earlier on. Welcome to Gibraltar! pic.twitter.com/rsm0ys0awT — Gibraltar Port (@gibraltarport) February 15, 2017 
M elnichenko’s custom-built luxury vessel is one of the largest and most advanced superyachts in the world. 
The company's website says the ship designed by French interior designer Philippe Starck was delivered earlier this month to its client. Sailing Yacht A after being released by the Gibraltese authorities in the British enclave in southern Spain Credit: EPA 
B efore its release, a spokesperson for Sailing Yacht A said: “We find this act of arrest of Sailing Yacht A in Gibraltar an astounding act for a shipbuilder of Nobiskrug's standing. 
“We assumed the matter was progressing to a resolution as Nobiskrug were happy to release the yacht on February 5th to the owner's project team for further works to be carried out in Spain.” 
Mr Melnichenko also owns a superyacht called Motor Yacht A which is reportedly up for sale for £209m. Follow Telegraph News
